section.heading: Purpose.
section.text: This chapter is promulgated pursuant to State Government Article, §10-122, Annotated Code of Maryland, for the purpose of establishing procedures by which the public may petition the Department of Commerce for the adoption of regulations.

para.text: In this chapter, the following terms have the meanings indicated.
"Secretary" means the Secretary of Business Commerce or the Secretary's designee.

section.heading: Who May File.
section.text: Any interested person may file a petition with the Secretary requesting the promulgation, amendment, or repeal of any regulation.

para.text: A clear and concise statement of the regulation, amendment, or repeal which is sought;
A statement of reasons in support of the proposed regulation change; and
The name, address, and telephone number of the petitioner.
The petition shall be filed with the Secretary for consideration and disposition.
The time period for response to a petition begins when the petition is received by the Secretary.

section.heading: Disposition.
section.text: Within 60 days after receipt of the petition, the Secretary shall either:

para.text: Deny the petition in writing, stating the reasons for the denial; or
Initiate the procedures for adoption of a regulation.
The Department shall maintain a file of all petitions submitted and the responses.
This file shall be available for public inspection to the extent permitted by law.
